page.title: 01High Force
page.content: The river Tees between High Force and Lowforce runs along the southern edge of the block. Two noth bank tributaries, Etters Gill Beck and Bowlee Beck flow south from the fells to the main stream. The main B6277 road follows the north bank of the river and is joined by 2 side roads from Ettersgill and Flushiemere. Isolated white washed farms are scattered throughout the area, with stone barns in many fields. The valley floor has some woodland but mainly hay meadows. Northwards rising ground is covered by stone walled intake pastures used for stock rearing. Visitors are catered for with Car Parks and Picnic Areas at High Force Hotel and at Bowlees. The latter has a Visitor Centre in an old chapel. The Pennine Way follows the south bank of the river Tees.
